dataObject.content: Amid pressure from Washington, Mexico is backpedaling on promises of better treatment for Central American migrants, leaving hundreds stranded in unsanitary camps near its southern border and allegations of irregular detentions.

annotationData.content: {"category":{"label":"Biased"},"rationale":"The United States is seeing a rise in apprehensions of unaccompanied migrant children, most from Central America, along its southern border"}
{"category":{"label":"Biased"},"rationale":"Because Migrant camps overflow as mexico cracks down after Trump threats."}
